quiz.question: Software engineering is only concerned with the technical process of software development.
quiz.suggestion: Review the definition and scope of software engineering.

quiz.question: Software costs often represent a significant fraction of GNP in all developed countries.
quiz.suggestion: Refer to the economic importance of software.

quiz.question: Maintenance costs for software are typically lower than development costs.
quiz.suggestion: Review the section on software costs, especially long-term maintenance.

quiz.question: Generic products are owned by the customer who commissions them.
quiz.suggestion: Distinguish between generic and customized products.

quiz.question: Customized products are developed for a specific customer to meet their own needs.
quiz.suggestion: Review the definitions of software product types.

quiz.question: Software engineering ethics only require compliance with the law.
quiz.suggestion: Review the principles of ethical behavior beyond legal requirements.

quiz.question: The IEEE/ACM Code of Ethics contains eight principles for software engineers.
quiz.suggestion: Refer to the ethical principles listed in the code.

quiz.question: Software reuse is not applicable to web-based systems.
quiz.suggestion: Review the approaches to building web-based systems.

quiz.question: Incremental and agile development is recommended for web-based systems.
quiz.suggestion: Check the development methodologies suitable for web-based systems.

quiz.question: Heterogeneity refers to systems operating uniformly on a single type of device.
quiz.suggestion: Understand the meaning of heterogeneity in distributed systems.

quiz.question: Business and social change require software to be adaptable and rapidly developed.
quiz.suggestion: Review the factors influencing software evolution.

quiz.question: Security and trust are not important for software that is not connected to the internet.
quiz.suggestion: Consider the broad impact of software on daily life.

quiz.question: Embedded control systems are the least common type of software system.
quiz.suggestion: Review the prevalence of embedded systems.

quiz.question: Stand-alone applications do not require network connectivity to function.
quiz.suggestion: Check the definition of stand-alone applications.

quiz.question: Batch processing systems are designed for real-time user interaction.
quiz.suggestion: Understand the purpose of batch processing systems.

quiz.question: Software engineering fundamentals include the importance of reusing existing software.
quiz.suggestion: Review the fundamental principles of software engineering.

quiz.question: Cloud computing requires users to purchase software licenses upfront.
quiz.suggestion: Review the pay-per-use model of cloud computing.

quiz.question: Web-based systems do not follow the fundamental principles of software engineering.
quiz.suggestion: Check the applicability of software engineering principles to web systems.

quiz.question: Confidentiality is only required if a formal agreement is signed.
quiz.suggestion: Review ethical responsibilities regarding confidentiality.

quiz.question: Software engineers should accept work outside their competence to gain experience.
quiz.suggestion: Review the principle of competence in professional ethics.

quiz.question: The ACM/IEEE Code of Ethics is intended only for practicing engineers, not students.
quiz.suggestion: Check who the code applies to.

quiz.question: Ethical principles for software engineers include acting in the public interest.
quiz.suggestion: Review the eight ethical principles.

quiz.question: Software engineers have no responsibility to their colleagues.
quiz.suggestion: Review principle 7 regarding colleagues.

quiz.question: An ethical dilemma may arise when disagreeing with management policies.
quiz.suggestion: Consider examples of ethical conflicts in software engineering.

quiz.question: Case studies in the chapter include a wilderness weather station.
quiz.suggestion: Review the list of case studies presented.

quiz.question: Software specification is not part of the software process activities.
quiz.suggestion: Review the key activities in software processes.

quiz.question: Software evolution involves modifying software to meet changing requirements.
quiz.suggestion: Understand the purpose of software evolution.

quiz.question: Dependability is only important for safety-critical systems.
quiz.suggestion: Review the universal importance of dependability.

quiz.question: Interactive transaction-based applications include e-commerce systems.
quiz.suggestion: Check examples of interactive transaction-based applications.

quiz.question: Entertainment systems are primarily designed for business use.
quiz.suggestion: Review the purpose of entertainment systems.

quiz.question: Systems for modelling and simulation are used by scientists and engineers.
quiz.suggestion: Check the description of modelling and simulation systems.

quiz.question: Data collection systems do not use sensors.
quiz.suggestion: Review how data collection systems operate.

quiz.question: Systems of systems are composed of a single software system.
quiz.suggestion: Understand the definition of systems of systems.

quiz.question: Professional software development always requires the use of software engineering methods.
quiz.suggestion: Review the importance of using engineering methods.

quiz.question: Software project failure can result from not using software engineering methods.
quiz.suggestion: Consider the consequences of neglecting engineering practices.

quiz.question: The software engineering code of ethics is only relevant in the United States.
quiz.suggestion: Review the global relevance of professional ethics.

quiz.question: Software engineers should protect the intellectual property of their employers.
quiz.suggestion: Review ethical responsibilities regarding intellectual property.

quiz.question: Computer misuse by software engineers is always considered a serious crime.
quiz.suggestion: Understand the range of behaviors considered misuse.

quiz.question: The insulin pump case study is an example of an embedded system.
quiz.suggestion: Review the description of the insulin pump case.

quiz.question: Mentcare is a system for managing financial records.
quiz.suggestion: Check the purpose of the Mentcare system.

quiz.question: iLearn is a digital learning environment for military training.
quiz.suggestion: Review the intended use of the iLearn system.

quiz.question: Software engineering diversity means one set of tools works for all systems.
quiz.suggestion: Understand why different systems require different approaches.

quiz.question: Web services allow application functionality to be accessed over the internet.
quiz.suggestion: Review the definition and use of web services.

quiz.question: Rich interfaces in web systems can be created using technologies like AJAX.
quiz.suggestion: Check the technologies mentioned for web interface development.

quiz.question: Software engineering is not necessary for small programming projects.
quiz.suggestion: Consider the long-term benefits of engineering practices.

quiz.question: All software systems must be specified completely before development begins.
quiz.suggestion: Review the incremental approach for web-based systems.

quiz.question: Professional societies do not set behavioral standards for software engineers.
quiz.suggestion: Review the role of professional codes of conduct.

quiz.question: Software engineers should only focus on technical issues, not social ones.
quiz.suggestion: Consider the broader responsibilities of software engineers.

quiz.question: The economies of developed nations are independent of software.
quiz.suggestion: Review the introductory statements on software's economic role.

quiz.question: Software engineering ethics are optional for professional practice.
quiz.suggestion: Understand the mandatory nature of ethical behavior in engineering.

quiz.question: The IEEE/ACM Code of Ethics is legally binding worldwide.
quiz.suggestion: Distinguish between ethical codes and legal requirements.

quiz.question: Service-oriented software engineering uses standalone web services as components.
quiz.suggestion: Review the definition of service-oriented systems.
